unnormalised: The National Health Authority (NHA) is pushing for wider adoption of the Ayushman Bharat Health Account (ABHA) ID. Think of ABHA as your unique digital health ID, sort of like your Aadhaar but for healthcare. It's a 14-digit number (e.g., 1234-5678-9012-34) that helps create a comprehensive health record for every Indian citizen.
normalised: The N-H-A is pushing for wider adoption of the Ayushman Bharat Health Account (A-B-H-A) I-D. Think of A-B-H-A as your unique digital health I-D, sort of like your Aadhaar but for healthcare. It's a fourteen-digit number (e.g., one two three four dash five six seven eight dash nine zero one two dash three four) that helps create a comprehensive health record for every Indian citizen.

unnormalised: Each time you visit a clinic, hospital, or lab that's part of the ABHA network, your health information gets linked to your ABHA ID. This allows doctors to access your medical history easily, leading to better-informed treatment decisions. Imagine Dr. Sharma in Delhi being able to instantly view your past allergies or medications prescribed by Dr. Patel in Mumbai, even if you're visiting her for the 1st time!

This allows doctors to access your medical history easily, leading to better-informed treatment decisions. Imagine Doctor Sharma in Delhi being able to instantly view your past allergies or medications prescribed by Doctor Patel in Mumbai, even if you're visiting her for the first time!

unnormalised: Insurance companies, too, are integrating ABHA. This means your policy number (e.g., Star Health Policy No. SHL/2023/12345) can be linked, streamlining claims processes. No more endless paperwork when submitting a claim! Some insurers are even offering discounts to policyholders who link their ABHA ID, encouraging greater adoption.
